DataElement.preferredName: COST - FACIT Version 2 FT9 How True Past Seven Days Concerned about Keeping Job and Income Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how true in the past 7 days they are concerned about keeping their job and income, including work at home.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: COST-FACIT How True Past Week Concerned about Keeping Job and Income Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed specifically to evaluate the financial distress experienced by cancer patients._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual is or was concerned about keeping their job and income, including work at home._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed specifically to evaluate the financial distress experienced by cancer patients.

Concepts.definition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed specifically to evaluate the financial distress experienced by cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: How True Past Week Concerned about Keeping Job and Income Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.:The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual is or was concerned about keeping their job and income, including work at home.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.
The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Concerned about Keeping Job and Income
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual is or was concerned about keeping their job and income, including work at home.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: COST-FACIT:Comprehensive Score for Financial Toxicity-Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy, A FACIT Measure of Financial Toxicity, David Cella, Ph.D., FACIT and The University of Chicago, 21 October 2014.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NRG study in Rave per request by D.Grant. mc 5/14/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on FACT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I am concerned about keeping
ReferenceDocuments.description: I am concerned about keeping my job and income, including work at home

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
